action_plan.description: Place a limit short entry order at 104951.0 near current price level.
action_plan.condition: If price remains near the bearish order block and FVG resistance zone.

action_plan.description: Monitor 15-minute candle closes for confirmation of rejection at entry zone.
action_plan.condition: Upon price approaching or touching the entry level.

action_plan.description: Set stop loss order at 106500.0, just above the bearish FVG and order block resistance zone.
action_plan.condition: Immediately after entry order is filled.

action_plan.description: Set take profit order at 104000.0, near recent lows supported by bearish momentum and derivatives selling pressure.
action_plan.condition: Immediately after entry order is filled.

action_plan.description: Continuously monitor derivative indicators (funding rate, open interest, CVD) for signs of short squeeze or reversal.
Adjust or exit position if price breaks above the bearish FVG and order block resistance zone between 105246.8 and 106446.4.

invalidation_triggers.description: Price closes decisively above 106500.0, invalidating the bearish breakout and short bias.
Price breaks and closes above the bearish FVG and order block resistance zone between 105246.8 and 106446.4.
Funding rate turns strongly positive and open interest rises significantly, indicating risk of short squeeze.
Entry condition not triggered within the next 12 hours after plan initiation.
Unexpected major bullish news or institutional inflows causing rapid price surge above resistance.

notes: The action plan prioritizes entering a short near current resistance zones with strict stop loss above key bearish FVG and order blocks. Given low confidence and poor risk-reward ratio, position sizing is conservative (2% risk). Continuous monitoring of momentum and derivatives data is crucial to detect potential short squeeze or invalidation. Re-entry or exit decisions should factor in price behavior relative to key resistance and breakout levels.
